summary: This is an email from Assistant U.S. Attorney Nathan to defense attorney Bobbi Chambers, with copies to Laura Menninger and others, regarding the case U.S. v. Maxwell. It transmits the Government's motion to preclude remaining defense experts, submitted temporarily under seal.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: Sends the Government's motion to preclude defense experts to Bobbi Chambers, indicating he is a prosecutor in the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Chambers
persons.context: Recipient of the email and attached motion; appears to be representing the defense in U.S. v. Maxwell.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Copied on the email regarding the Daubert motion in U.S. v. Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Mentioned in the email signature or context, likely part of the legal correspondence.

connections.description: Prosecutor communicating with defense attorney regarding a motion in U.S. v. Maxwell.
Prosecutor copying defense attorney on legal correspondence.
Both are attorneys involved in the U.S. v. Maxwell case, copied on the same email.

events.title: Government files Daubert motion
events.description: The Government files a motion to preclude the remaining defense experts in U.S. v. Maxwell, submitted temporarily under seal.

keyFacts: The document is an email from AUSA Nathan to defense attorney Bobbi Chambers regarding U.S. v. Maxwell.
The Government filed a motion to preclude the remaining defense experts, submitted temporarily under seal.
The correspondence involves legal professionals including Laura Menninger and Jeff Pagliuca.
The case referenced is U.S. v. Maxwell, 20 CR 330 (AJN), indicating ongoing legal proceedings against Ghislaine Maxwell.
